name: ms_q96
title: **Python: Sum of subarray minimums (stack core)**
choices:
```python
stack = []
for i in range(n + 1):
    cur = arr[i] if i < n else -1
    while stack and arr[stack[-1]] >= cur:
        mid = stack.pop()
        left = mid - (stack[-1] if stack else -1)
        right = i - mid
        ans = (ans + arr[mid] * left * right) % MOD
    stack.append(i)
```

```python
stack = []
for i in range(n):
    while stack and arr[stack[-1]] < arr[i]:
        stack.pop()
    stack.append(i)
```

```python
stack = []
for i in range(n):
    if stack and arr[stack[-1]] >= arr[i]:
        ans += arr[i]
    stack.append(i)
```
correctAnswer:
```python
stack = []
for i in range(n + 1):
    cur = arr[i] if i < n else -1
    while stack and arr[stack[-1]] >= cur:
        mid = stack.pop()
        left = mid - (stack[-1] if stack else -1)
        right = i - mid
        ans = (ans + arr[mid] * left * right) % MOD
    stack.append(i)
```

name: ms_q100
title: **Python: Online stock span (stack of pairs)**
choices:
```python
stack = []
def next_price(price):
    span = 1
    while stack and stack[-1][1] <= price:
        span += stack.pop()[0]
    stack.append((span, price))
    return span
```

```python
stack = []
def next_price(price):
    while stack and stack[-1] >= price:
        stack.pop()
    return price
```
correctAnswer:
```python

def next_price(price):
    span = 1
    while stack and stack[-1][1] <= price:
        span += stack.pop()[0]
    stack.append((span, price))
    return span
```

name: ms_q105
title: **Python: Trapping rain water (core while loop)**
choices:
```python
while stack and height[i] > height[stack[-1]]:
    top = stack.pop()
    if not stack:
        break
    distance = i - stack[-1] - 1
    bounded = min(height[i], height[stack[-1]]) - height[top]
    ans += distance * bounded
```

```python
while stack and height[i] < height[stack[-1]]:
    ans += 1
```
correctAnswer:
```python
while stack and height[i] > height[stack[-1]]:
    top = stack.pop()
    if not stack:
        break
    distance = i - stack[-1] - 1
    bounded = min(height[i], height[stack[-1]]) - height[top]
    ans += distance * bounded
```
